early.description: Born on a spacecraft, you grew up navigating tight corridors and complex machinery.
At age eight, you repaired a malfunctioning air filter, impressing the crew with your aptitude.
You began an apprenticeship under the ship's chief engineer, learning the basics of maintenance.
A power surge almost caused a catastrophic failure, teaching you the importance of vigilance.
You developed a knack for moving swiftly through the ship's ductwork to reach critical areas.
Witnessing a system malfunction that injured a crew member instilled in you a sense of responsibility.
You customized your toolkit for efficiency, demonstrating your innovative spirit.
An older technician taught you advanced diagnostics, enhancing your technical skills.
You formed a bond with another young crew member, exploring the ship and sharing dreams.
A sudden decompression required you to seal a breach quickly, showcasing your agility under pressure.
You began studying advanced engineering manuals, expanding your knowledge base.
An error you made caused a minor system failure, teaching you humility and the value of double-checking work.
You discovered an inefficiency in the ship's engine output, leading to improvements.
A mysterious signal intercepted during maintenance sparked your curiosity about the unknown.
You customized a maintenance drone to assist in repairs, increasing efficiency.
An illness confined you to quarters, teaching you patience and the importance of self-care.
You began to question the corporation's policies after noticing discrepancies in supply allocations.

mid.description: You were promoted to junior technician, taking on more complex tasks.
A critical system failure required you to perform emergency repairs in hazardous conditions.
You designed a software patch that improved system stability.
An encounter with space debris damaged the ship, and you had to coordinate repairs quickly.
You began mentoring a new technician, sharing your expertise.
A malfunction you couldn't immediately fix caused self-doubt, affecting your performance.
You discovered unauthorized modifications to ship systems, raising security concerns.
An opportunity to transfer to a state-of-the-art vessel arose, challenging your loyalties.
You developed a rivalry with another technician, pushing both of you to excel.
An EVA mission required you to repair external components, confronting your fear of open space.

late.description: Promoted to senior technician, you now oversee critical ship systems.
A catastrophic event required you to coordinate repairs to save the ship.
You discovered a corporate cover-up involving faulty equipment.
A mysterious illness spread among the crew, possibly linked to environmental controls you manage.
You were offered a position on a pioneering deep-space mission, challenging your comfort zone.
An AI system you helped develop began exhibiting erratic behavior.
Budget cuts forced you to make tough decisions about maintenance priorities, impacting safety.
You began to suffer from fatigue due to prolonged shifts, questioning corporate policies.
A faction within the crew sought your expertise to modify the ship for their own agenda.
You mentored a prodigy who could potentially surpass you, prompting reflections on your legacy.
An incident led to you being falsely accused of sabotage, threatening your career.
You discovered alien technology integrated into the ship without crew knowledge.
A personal tragedy affected your focus, causing you to reconsider your path.
You authored a comprehensive guide on ship maintenance, solidifying your expertise.
An opportunity to retire or take shore leave presented itself, but you struggled with the decision.
You faced a moral dilemma when ordered to prioritize a corporate mission over crew safety.
An external threat, such as pirates or a rival corporation, required you to use your skills defensively.
